meanings.definition: A loop of thread or yarn used to join fabric or make a decorative border.
meanings.sent1: Mom sewed the torn shirt with neat stitches.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully added stitches to the hem of the dress.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the loose stitches on the pillow.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like stitches, weaving a story that held us all.
meanings.sent5: The colorful stitches on the quilt created a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: A sudden sharp pain in the side.
meanings.sent1: After running, he felt sharp stitches in his side.
meanings.sent2: She paused, clutching her side from the sudden stitches.
meanings.sent3: The laughter at the joke gave him unexpected stitches in his side.
meanings.sent4: The memory of the accident left emotional stitches in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news hit him like painful stitches in his side.

meanings.definition: A length of thread or yarn wound in a single turn around a needle.
meanings.sent1: She threaded the needle with a long piece of stitches.
meanings.sent2: The knitter carefully added more stitches to the row.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy attempt at sewing resulted in tangled stitches on the fabric.
meanings.sent4: His words were like carefully placed stitches in the fabric of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the needle pulling through the stitches was soothing.
